com.neovisionaries.bluetooth.ble.advertising

Class Ucode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.neovisionaries.bluetooth.ble.advertising.ADStructure
      • com.neovisionaries.bluetooth.ble.advertising.ADManufacturerSpecific
        • com.neovisionaries.bluetooth.ble.advertising.Ucode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Ucode
extends ADManufacturerSpecific
    ucode: 128-bit ID for real objects.

    ucode (written in lower case) is a global ID system defined by T-Engine Forum. The specification has been adopted as ITU-T H.642.

    This class represents Bluetooth LE ucode Marker which is an AD structure to convey a ucode in BLE advertising packets.

    Since:
    1.1
    See Also:
    Packet Format Specification for Bluetooth LE ucode Marker [01.A0.01] (in Japanese), Ucode system, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ucode

        public Ucode()
        Constructor which creates an instance with version=3, ucode=all-zeros, status=0, power=0, count=0.

      • Ucode

        public Ucode(int length,
             int type,
             byte[] data,
             int companyId)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the AD structure.
        type - The AD type. The value should always be 0xFF (Manufacturer Specific Data).
        data - The AD data whose format is Bluetooth LE ucode Marker.
        companyId - The company ID. The value should always be 0x019A (T-Engine Forum).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - data is null or the length of data is less than 22.

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public int getVersion()
        Get the version of the packet format of Bluetooth LE ucode Marker.
        Returns:
        The version number.

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(int version)
        Set the version of the packet format of Bluetooth LE ucode Marker.
        Parameters:
        version - The version number. The value should be in the range from 0 to 255.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The given value is out of the valid range.

      • getUcode

        public String getUcode()
        Get the ucode.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the ucode. It consists of 32 upper-case hex letters.

      • setUcode

        public void setUcode(String ucode)
        Set the ucode.
        Parameters:
        ucode - The string representation of the ucode. It must consist of 32 hex letters.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - ucode is null or it does not consist of 32 hex letters.

      • getStatus

        public int getStatus()
        Get the status.

        The meanings of the bits are as follows.

        7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
        Reserved Reserved Low
        Battery        		 1 Transmission Interval

        Combinations of the bits of Transmission Interval have the following meanings.

        Bits Interval (ms)
        0b0000 10
        0b0001 20
        0b0010 40
        0b0011 80
        0b0100 160
        0b0101 320
        0b0110 640
        0b0111 1280
        0b1000 2560
        0b1001 5120
        Others 10240
        Returns:
        The status.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(int status)
        Set the status.
        Parameters:
        status - The status.

      • isBatteryLow

        public boolean isBatteryLow()
        Get the flag value that indicates whether the battery is low or not.

        The returned value is the boolean representation of the Low Battery bit of the status.

        Returns:
        The flag value that indicates whether the battery is low or not.

      • getInterval

        public int getInterval()
        Get the transmission interval in milliseconds.

        The returned value is calculated from the bits of Transmission Interval in the status.

        Returns:
        The transmission interval in milliseconds.

      • getPower

        public int getPower()
        Get the transmission power in dBm.
        Returns:
        The transmission power in dBm.

      • setPower

        public void setPower(int power)
        Set the transmission power in dBm.
        Parameters:
        power - The transmission power in dBm. The valid range is from -128 to 127.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The given value is out of the valid range.

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Get the transmission count.

        The value of the transmission count field is incremented per transmission. Note that the next value of 0xFF is 0x00.

        Returns:
        The transmission count.

      • setCount

        public void setCount(int count)
        Set the transmission count.
        Parameters:
        count - The transmission count. The value should be in the range from 0x00 to 0xFF.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The given value is out of the valid range.

      • create

        public static Ucode create(int length,
                           int type,
                           byte[] data,
                           int companyId)
        Create a Ucode instance.

        The format of data should be as described in the following table.

        Value Description
        Company ID 0x9A 0x01 The company ID assigned to T-Engine Forum. (Little Endian)
        Version 1-byte unsigned number The version number of Bluetooth LE ucode Marker.
        Ucode 16-byte data Ucode in the little endian order.
        Status 1-byte data Bit flags that represents the status of the peripheral device.
        Transmission Power 1-byte signed number. Transmission power in dBm.
        Transmission Count 1-byte unsigned number. The counter value incremented per transmission.
        Reserved 3-byte zeros. Reserved for future use.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the AD structure.
        type - The AD type. The value should always be 0xFF which represents Manufacturer Specific Data.
        data - The AD type. The value of the first two bytes is the company ID.
        companyId - The company ID. The value should always be 0x019A which represents T-Engine Forum
        Returns:
        A Ucode instance. null is returned if the length of data is less than 22.

        public String toString()
